item.title: Why Are Organizations Losing the Ransomware Battle?
item.content:encoded: Institutionalizing and sustaining fundamental cybersecurity practices requires a commitment to ongoing vigilance, active management, and a comprehensive understanding of evolving threats.

item.title: New Banshee Stealer macOS Malware Priced at $3,000 Per Month - SecurityWeek

item.title: White House Pledges $10 Million for Open Source Initiative
item.content:encoded: The Open-Source Software Prevalence Initiative, announced at DEF CON, will examine how open source software is used in critical infrastructure.

item.title: DARPA Announces AI Cyber Challenge Finalists
item.content:encoded: Teams designed AI systems to secure open source infrastructure software to be used in industries like financial services, utilities, and healthcare. Each finalist was awarded a $2 million prize.

item.title: Unfixed Microsoft Entra ID Authentication Bypass Threatens Hybrid IDs
item.content:encoded: The attack affects organizations that have synced multiple on-premises Active Directory domains to a single Azure tenant.

item.title: SolarWinds: Critical RCE Bug Requires Urgent Patch
item.content:encoded: The vulnerability was given a high-severity CVSS score, indicating that customers should act swiftly to mitigate the flaw.

item.title: Google: Iran's Charming Kitten Targets US Presidential Elections, Israeli Military
item.content:encoded: The threat group tracked as APT42 remains on the warpath with various phishing and other social engineering campaigns, as tensions with Israel rise.

item.title: How Can Organizations Navigate SEC's Cyber Materiality Disclosures?
item.content:encoded: Inconsistencies and lack of information in cybersecurity disclosures highlight the need for organizations to establish a robust materiality assessment framework.

item.title: Beyond the Hype: Unveiling the Realities of WormGPT in Cybersecurity
item.content:encoded: Though WormGPT tools may not be a major problem now, organizations can't let their guard down.

item.title: Ransomware Group Behind Major Indonesian Attack Wears Many Masks
item.content:encoded: Brain Cipher made a loud entry to the ransomware scene, but it doesn't seem to be quite as sophisticated as its accomplishment would suggest.

item.title: New ISAGCA Report Explores Zero-Trust Outcomes in OT Cybersecurity
item.content:encoded: New ISAGCA Report Explores Zero-Trust Outcomes in OT Cybersecurity

item.title: 'EastWind' Cyber-Spy Campaign Combines Various Chinese APT Tools
item.content:encoded: The likely China-linked campaign is deploying CloudSorcerer and other proprietary binaries belonging to known state-sponsored groups, showing how advanced persistent threat groups often collaborate with each other.

item.title: Mimecast Announces Acquisition of Aware, Doubles Down on AI-Powered Human Risk Management Capabilities
item.content:encoded: Mimecast Announces Acquisition of Aware, Doubles Down on AI-Powered Human Risk Management Capabilities

item.content:encoded: DigiCert to Acquire Vercara

item.content:encoded: Guardz Launches Free 'Community Shield' Plan to Empower MSPs

item.title: Gcore Radar Report Shows 46% Increase in Number of DDoS Attacks in First Half of 2024
item.content:encoded: Gcore Radar Report Shows 46% Increase in Number of DDoS Attacks in First Half of 2024

item.title: Zimperium Teams Up With Okta to Enhance Zero-Trust Identity Threat Protection With AI-Driven Mobile Security Solutions
item.content:encoded: Zimperium Teams Up With Okta to Enhance Zero-Trust Identity Threat Protection With AI-Driven Mobile Security Solutions

item.title: Digital Align Inc. Achieves SOC 2 Type 2 Certification for Secure Automation Intelligence
item.content:encoded: Digital Align Inc. Achieves SOC 2 Type 2 Certification for Secure Automation Intelligence

item.title: Experian Acquires Behavioral Analytics Company NeuroID
item.content:encoded: Experian Acquires Behavioral Analytics Company NeuroID

item.title: UK Royal Family, Prime Minister Deepfakes Make Rounds on Meta
item.content:encoded: According to the researchers, roughly 250 fake advertisements appeared on platforms like Facebook and Instagram, and some are reportedly still up and running.

item.title: Cybersecurity's Real Challenge Is Communication, Not Just Technology
item.content:encoded: By nurturing a security-centric work culture that involves everybody, organizations can overcome challenges with greater agility and confidence.

item.title: Cybercriminal Leader 'J.P.Morgan' Busted for Pioneering RaaS Model
item.content:encoded: Maksim Silnikau and his associates are accused of developing and distributing notorious ransomware strains such as Reveton and Ransom Cartel, among other criminal acts.

item.title: NIST Releases 3 Post-Quantum Standards, Urges Orgs to Start PQC Journey
item.content:encoded: Security experts welcome the long-anticipated publication of the first post-quantum cryptographic standards as a significant milestone.

item.title: DNC Credentials Compromised by 'IntelFetch' Telegram Bot
item.content:encoded: The Democratic National Convention soon to take place in Chicago, already under heavy security, faces an additional threat in the form of stolen credentials for delegates.

item.title: Inc Ransomware Encryptor Contains Keys to Victim Data Recovery
item.content:encoded: The threat group is disrupting healthcare organizations. Victims can help themselves, though, even after compromise, by being careful in the decryption process.

item.title: It's Time to Promote Security Talent From Within
item.content:encoded: While there are smart people and good leaders in other fields, we need to cultivate and grow leaders from the existing cybersecurity workforce, too.

item.title: Gold Mining Company Struck by Ransomware Attack
item.content:encoded: Australia's Evolution Mining said its IT systems were infected with ransomware in an Aug. 8 cyber incident.

item.title: Microsoft Discloses 10 Zero-Day Bugs in Patch Tuesday Update
item.content:encoded: Attackers are already actively exploiting six of the bugs and four others are public, including one for which Microsoft has no patch yet.

item.title: NIST Finalizes Post-Quantum Encryption Standards
item.content:encoded: The new standards are designed for two tasks: general encryption and digital signatures.

item.title: Cybercriminal Duo Attracts FBI Notice by Spending Big & Living Large
item.content:encoded: Cash may be king, but law enforcement keeps track of who spends it, especially when it's in the six-figure range.

item.title: Critical Ivanti vTM Bug Allows Unauthorized Admin Access
item.content:encoded: The CVSS 9.8 authentication bypass in Ivanti's traffic manager admin panel already has a proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit lurking in the wild.

item.title: Microsoft Azure AI Health Bot Infected With Critical Vulnerabilities
item.content:encoded: Privilege escalation flaws in the healthcare chatbot platform could have allowed unauthorized cross-tenant access and management of other customersâ€™ resources.

item.title: APT41 Spinoff Expands Chinese Actor's Scope Beyond Asia
item.content:encoded: Earth Baku, yet another subgroup of the highly active and increasingly sophisticated collective, is moving into EMEA with new malware and living-off-the-land (LotL) tactics.

item.title: FBI Shuts Down Dozens of Radar/Dispossessor Ransomware Servers
item.content:encoded: Computer infrastructure in the US, UK, and Germany associated with the cybercriminal group, which targeted SMBs using double extortion, is officially out of commission.

item.title: The Changing Expectations for Developers in an AI-Coding Future
item.content:encoded: AI's proficiency at creating software code won't put developers out of a job, but the job will change to one focused on security, collaboration, and "mentoring" AI models.

item.title: DARPA Aims to Ditch C Code, Move to Rust
item.content:encoded: The Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency launches TRACTOR program to work with university and industry researchers on creating a translation system that can turn C code into secure, idiomatic Rust code.

item.title: CrowdStrike Tries to Patch Things Up With Cybersecurity Industry
item.content:encoded: CrowdStrike's president and CEO were both at Black Hat and DEF CON to face direct questions from customers and cybersecurity professionals.

item.title: UN Approves Cybercrime Treaty Despite Major Tech, Privacy Concerns
item.content:encoded: The treaty would allow any country to request technology firms to aid in cybercrime investigations and preserve data about their users â€” potentially imperiling penetration testers and security researchers, among others.

item.title: AMD Issues Updates for Silicon-Level 'SinkClose' Processor Flaw
item.content:encoded: The vulnerability has been around for nearly 20 years and gives sophisticated attackers a way to bury virtually undetectable bootkits on devices with EPYC and Ryzen microprocessors.

item.title: Ukraine CERT: Mass Phishing Campaign Poses as Nation's Security Service
item.content:encoded: More than 100 Ukrainian government devices have been affected by the threat that is being tracked as UAC-0198.

item.title: CLFS Bug Crashes Even Updated Windows 10, 11 Systems
item.content:encoded: A quick and easy exploit for crashing Windows computers has no fix yet nor really any way to mitigate its effects.

item.title: A Lesson From the CrowdStrike Incident
item.content:encoded: The recent outage highlights the critical importance of adhering to established processes and governance frameworks.

item.title: Tennessee Man Helped DPRK Workers Get Jobs at US Orgs, Fund WMDs
item.content:encoded: US citizens play middleman between US companies and the North Korean government agents they unwittingly hire.

item.title: Healthcare Providers Must Plan for Ransomware Attacks on Third-Party Suppliers
item.content:encoded: The American Hospital Association and Health-ISAC issued a joint threat bulletin warning healthcare IT providers that their ransomware plans need to consider third-party risk.

item.title: Vectra AI Expands XDR Platform to Deliver a Real-Time View of Active Posture to Monitor Exposure to Attackers
item.content:encoded: Vectra AI Expands XDR Platform to Deliver a Real-Time View of Active Posture to Monitor Exposure to Attackers

item.content:encoded: WiCyS and ISC2 Launch Fall Camp for Cybersecurity Certification

item.title: Solar Power Installations Worldwide Open to Cloud API Bugs
item.content:encoded: The weaknesses gave attackers an avenue to take over millions of photovoltaic devices connected to Solarman and Deye's cloud-hosted management systems.

item.content:encoded: Progress Announces Conclusion of SEC Investigation into MOVEit

item.title: Media & Victims Find Common Ground Against Hackers
item.content:encoded: In a panel at Black Hat 2024, journalists and investigators explain their differing goals when a victim organization is breached.

item.title: Rubrik Partners With Mandiant for Cyber Resilience and Accelerated Incident Response Recovery
item.content:encoded: Rubrik Partners With Mandiant for Cyber Resilience and Accelerated Incident Response Recovery

item.title: Tackling Vulnerabilities & Errors Head-on for Proactive Security
item.content:encoded: As attack surfaces increase, partner networks widen, and security teams remain stretched, vulnerabilities and errors continue to be a daunting challenge.

item.title: Dark Reading News Desk Live From Black Hat USA 2024
item.content:encoded: The Dark Reading team spent two days on the Dark Reading News Desk interviewing the world's top cybersecurity experts.

item.title: Memory Safety Is Key to Preventing Hardware Hacks
item.content:encoded: Spectre and Meltdown exposed just how easy a target computer memory was for attackers. Several efforts are underway to protect memory.

item.title: GitHub Attack Vector Cracks Open Google, Microsoft, AWS Projects
item.content:encoded: Cloud services and thus millions of end users who access them could have been affected by the poisoning of artifacts in the development workflow of open source projects.
